intro: Milleria alba, commonly known as the white milleria, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, white, five-petaled flowers that bloom in summer. It has palmate leaves with five to seven lobes, and it thrives in well-drained soil and full sun. Milleria alba is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
